sources.data_found: The GPU cluster contains 16 GPU nodes and one storage node. In total, it has 24 Tesla V100 32GB GPUs and 40 Titan V 12 GB GPUs.
The CS department has a small GPU cluster for student use. The cluster consists of four nodes and 32 GPUs.
To request an A40 GPU (which have 48 GiB of GPU RAM, in contrast to the A5000's 24 GiB of GPU RAM), specify the gpu48g partition
During the 2021-2022 academic year, Brandeis University handed out 99 bachelor's degrees in computer science. This is an increase of 15% over the previous year when 86 degrees were handed out.
In 2021, 30 students received their master's degree in compsci from Brandeis. There were 2 students who received their doctoral degrees in compsci.
The department has 12 research faculty members with diverse research interests, plus several teaching faculty and research associates.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate CS count estimated from 99 bachelor's degrees awarded in 2021-2022 × 4-year program = 396 students. MS count estimated from 28-30 master's degrees × 1.5-year average completion = 42 students. PhD count estimated from 2 doctoral degrees × 5.5-year average completion = 11 students.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: CS student cluster - estimated half of the 32 GPUs are A5000s based on partition descriptions

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS INCLUDED:

1) MRSEC GPU Cluster: 16 nodes total with 24 Tesla V100 32GB + 40 Titan V 12GB = 64 GPUs

2) CS Student Cluster: 4 nodes × 8 GPUs/node = 32 GPUs. Based on partition info mentioning A40 (48GB) and A5000 (24GB), estimated 16 A40 + 16 A5000.

TOTAL KNOWN GPUs: 96 (24 V100 + 40 Titan V + 16 A40 + 16 A5000)

analysis_notes: Brandeis has modest GPU resources compared to larger research universities, with 96 total GPUs across two clusters. The MRSEC cluster uses older V100 and Titan V GPUs, while the CS student cluster has newer Ampere-generation A40 and A5000 GPUs. With approximately 449 CS students total, this yields about 0.21 GPUs per CS student.
